As We Grew Older this guidance to be
nice continued to be facilitated and
reinforced from parents to teachers from
religious figures to cartoon aardvarks
and TV commercials about soda
in a world where there are awful people
where awful things happen where
existence and even its most basic
optimal form is filled with chaos and
hardship and suffering the guidance to
be nice and striving to be nice is
unequivocally a good thing
but for many of us this is about where
it ends and The crucial nuances of what
it means to be kind in a complicated
world and the potential consequences of
misunderstanding how to be are left
without further guidance or
clarification
of course nice is a relatively vague

niceness here is to mean a sort of
substantial aversion to negatively

to put one's own views sensibilities and
Desires in second or last place
of course this definition May differ

but that is part of the problem niceness
is so easily misunderstood
this sort of niceness though it may seem
Pleasant on balance and over even a

interact with
the consequences of this sort of

does it might lead one into jobs they

generally the nice person's goal is
presumably to be nice but not only does

Unfaithful deception and truth always
agreeing with what a person says or

as a participant in friendships

if we truly wish to be good and
meaningful contributors to our social
relations our work our self we must
recognize the different kinds of
niceness here we can refer to the more
optimal kind as kindness and what

degree of authentic participation care
and honesty with others which often

uncomfortable moments and conversations

it is and it will be telling a friend

may not feel nice but it is and it will

Kennedy returned to his apartment and
sat by himself at his kitchen table he
ate while using the swap app he was
swapping with the famous wealthy man who
often hung out with attractive women and
lived what seemed like a luxurious
active lifestyle Kennedy didn't really
know why he did this he didn't care
about the man he didn't even really want
to be like the man and the experience
was often riddled with anxious and
depressive feelings but it was some
strange period curiosity that Kennedy
couldn't seem to help himself from
most of us can relate to this experience
in some capacity becoming absorbed and
almost possessed by technology or any
social phenomenon for that matter often
without even really thinking about it or
understanding why my new book millions
of little threads which that excerpt is
from explores topics like these how we
become alienated from ourselves as
individuals and as collectives how we
deal with and become victims to
increasingly passive modes of life and
what we experience personally as a
result of this the story is one hour
long and is just 3.99 as an audiobook on
